Comment: Democrat was at a conference in South Korea and could not attend, the Republicans knew this and chose to hold the vote in his absence.   The final tally was 49-49 with a tiebreaker by VP JD Vance.   I wanted to make sure that when you're buying groceries on credit, you all know who to thank for your predicament.

Author: Routine-Reaction-592

Comment: Such a non-issue.  First of all:  > Even if it did pass the Senate, the House wasn't expected to take up the resolution after Republicans passed a rule that specifically blocks this type of resolution until the end of September. Trump would also likely have vetoed the resolution if it reached his desk.  So the whole resolution was just performative.  Secondly:  > The resolution was tied after three Republicans—Senators Rand Paul, Susan Collins, and Lisa Murkowski—joined Democrats in supporting the rebuke of Trump's tariffs.  So the "controlled opposition" on the GOP side got their go-ahead to express their concern because the leadership knew that the vote was in the bag. If Sen. Whitehouse had been there, one of those three would've joined the other Republicans, as is tradition.
Author: Rannasha

Maybe they figure by the time they're up for reelection, the only constituents left to vote will be the ones with plenty of money.
